turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Automag (paintball marker).
turn.1: What was the biggest problem with the Automag?
turn.2: Shootdown became impossible, as these valves recharged faster than anyone could pull the trigger; in fact, due to their design, they heated up under rapid fire and actually experienced shootup instead.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Unfortunately, the original design was fed its gas through the marker's rail, and thus was incompatible as an upgrade to older Automags.
turn.5: Did most people try to fix the problem?
turn.6: This did not fit Airgun Designs' vision of customer support, and it was soon superseded by another design.
turn.7: What was the most common solution?
turn.8: The ReTro Valve was a new version of the RT valve, designed to be compatible with older Automags.
turn.9: Did this cause any other problems?
turn.10: While initially sold as an upgrade, it soon became the standard for all new high-end Automags, and was used as the basis for the MicroMag, a collaborative project with PTP (Pro Team Products).
turn.12: It was also used as the initial valve for the E-Mag.
